page.title: 01THE AREA SOUTH OF STOCKPORT
page.content: This block is situated just to the south of Stockport city centre, and is on the edge of the Manchester conurbation. The main A6 road to Buxton runs through the area as a corridor containing many shops and some small factories. Largely though, the area is made up of residential housing, dating from Victorian terraced housing in Edgeley to new houses on the southern edge of Hazel Grove. Stockport itself grew dramatically during the industrial revolution. Our block contains a large unusual{Town {Hall,}the{Railway Station}and{War {Memorial.}More recent buildings include{Stockport Technical College and the{Telephone Exchange.
